resources.string: If you ask what to see in Vinnytsia, everyone will say without hesitation: first of all, the light and music fountain Roshen on the Pivdennyi Buh, which was inaugurated in 2011. It is currently the largest floating fountain in Europe. According to experts, it is also among the ten most spectacular fountains in the world. The vertical jet is 60 meters high and the frontal span is 140 meters. The use of a laser projector and a water-air screen allows the demonstration of video in 3D. During the day, jets of water create an effect of harmony and tranquility, and in the evening, a grand show begins: various multimedia masterpieces are shown in front of a large open-air auditorium on a giant water canvas. The combination of classical music, dance performances and vivid stories attracts people to admire the show and makes the fountain a symbol of the City of ideas. Each thematic program is not just an entertaining water show, but a real work of contemporary art and is designed for the general public, regardless of age, gender and preferences.

The park around the square is located in the heart of the city and is one of the favorite places for recreation. It is here that the Artynov Water Tower, the main symbol of Vinnytsia and its business card, is located. At the beginning of the 20th century, the architect Hryhorii Artynov designed it as a water pumping station for the city water supply system and an observation tower of the fire-brigade. The clock was supposed to give it a town hall-like appearance. For more than a hundred years of existence, the tower has performed various functions and changed many residents. Currently, it is a home to the Museum of Vinnytsia. Young musicians often perform on European Square, themed locations are set up during festivals and celebrations, and walking in the park is a pleasure at any time of the year. The melody of the legendary Shchedryk (Carol of the Bells) by Leontovych, which made him famous all over the world, is heard from the tower.

It was once called Mykolaivska Avenue, then Poshtova. Today it has an extremely elegant name — Soborna. At all times, the main artery of the city has been in the vortex of events. Decorated with monumental structures, majestic buildings of different historical eras, it attracts tourists from different countries. The author of many architectural masterpieces was the first city architect Hryhorii Artynov. The buildings of the City Duma and the women’s gymnasium, the elegant Savoy Hotel – the architect actually created the face of the city. Part of the street is paved with cobblestones, which also gives it a special, historic charm.

The main tourist attractions of the City of ideas are headed by the Pirogov Museum in Vinnytsia. When asked “What to see in Vinnytsia first?” every resident of Vinnytsia will confidently name this iconic place, along with the Mykhailo Kotsiubynskyi Museum-Estate, the legendary Vinnytsia Mures, or the Vinnytsia Catacombs. For a long time, Nikolai Pirogov was the center of the city’s life, settling in the picturesque Vyshnia estate. He was a world-renowned scientist, a brilliant surgeon, and a talented teacher whose achievements are hard to overestimate. It was here that the “Vinnytsia stage” of his life, which lasted more than 20 years, took place. To this day, grateful descendants visit the National Pirogov’s Estate Museum and the church-tomb of Pirogov, where his embalmed body lies. Tourists from all over the world come here! The museum and estate complex, dedicated to the life and work of the prominent surgeon, is located in a picturesque place near Vyshenske Lake. Today, it is not only a cultural landmark of Vinnytsia, but also one of the most popular tourist attractions in the city. Here you can delve into the life story of an extraordinary person, learn a lot of interesting things about an outstanding doctor, enjoy a walk in a cozy park and buy souvenirs. By the way, you can also buy nice little things to remember your trip and useful things in other parts of the city.

Address: 34 Soborna St. Phones: Reception: +380 68 055-88-88, Reservation Department: +380 63 552-92-11, Conference Service: +380 68 055-88-87. Website: hotelfrance.com.ua Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/hotelfranceua/

Shop-restaurant of the chain of the same name. The menu includes fish and seafood caught on our own pier in the village of Mykolaivka in the Odesa region.
18 Mykoly Ovodova St +380 96 994-05-05 https://www.instagram.com/chernomorka.vinnytsia

Vinnytsia bistro of Pan-Asian cuisine, which offers a wide range of Far Eastern dishes. Peking duck in a traditional serving, seafood and other delicacies of the Celestial Empire.
2 Karmeliuka St +380 67 103-01-10 https://lastchinese.choiceqr.com https://www.fb.com/lastchinese
